title: Choking - Adult
summary: Emergency procedure for helping an adult who is choking and cannot cough, speak, or breathe.

steps.title: Recognize Choking Signs
steps.description: Look for universal choking sign - hands clutched to throat. Person cannot speak, cough, or breathe. Face may turn blue or red. Act immediately if these signs are present.

steps.title: Position Yourself
steps.description: Stand behind the person. Wrap your arms around their waist. Make a fist with one hand and place it slightly above the navel, thumb side in.

steps.title: Perform Abdominal Thrusts
steps.description: Grasp your fist with your other hand. Give quick, upward thrusts into the abdomen. Repeat until the object is expelled or the person becomes unconscious.

steps.title: If Person Becomes Unconscious
steps.description: Lower the person to the ground. Call 911 immediately. Begin CPR, starting with chest compressions. Before giving breaths, look in the mouth for the object and remove it if visible.

warnings: Do not perform abdominal thrusts on pregnant women - use chest thrusts instead
Never perform a blind finger sweep in the mouth
For obese persons, perform chest thrusts if you cannot wrap arms around waist
whenToSeekHelp: Call 911 if the person becomes unconscious
Seek medical attention after successful removal of object
Get immediate help if abdominal thrusts are not working
preventionTips: Cut food into small pieces and chew thoroughly
Avoid talking or laughing while eating
Keep small objects away from young children
